Posts.Content: Aug 25, 2010 11:57AM Nan wrote: Dear ladies, I have been posting updates from Caryn's carepage on the TNBC site, since October of 2008. It was an agreement between Caryn and me when she was too ill to post. I knew all too well, that this post from Steve was one that would break my heart. It did. Nan (Nancy from the TNBC site) This is from Steve..... jacta alea est Posted 3 hours ago This is Latin for 'the die is cast' and was supposedly said by Julius Caesar when he crossed the Rubicon and started the war in 49 BCE. Basically the decision has been made and there's no turning back. I visited with Caryn this afternon, joined later by the always funny, always food-bearing Carol Morgan. I was able to have Ms Kathryn McGuire , the social worker, come in and talk to us and Caryn is coming home, most likely on Thursday to begin the end on her terms, as if she would have it any other way. She's tired, folks......tired of the diarrhea, the dehydration, the long days in infusion, the loss of cognitive ability, the everything associated with this disease and she just wants it to stop. Short of a miraculous cure, there's only one way out and she's taking it. As there's no arguing with her (There never is) on this, we must support her decision and come to grips with it as best we can.
Posts.Title: #3 Has anyone heard from CarynRose? jeanne46 Honeybear
